P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

For the question P regarding whether a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, I consider the current political landscape, the popularity of Donald Trump, and the potential candidacy of his family members. Given the significant influence and visibility of the Trump family, I estimate a moderate to high probability that one of them will secure the nomination. 

For not_P, which states that no member of the Trump family will be the nominee, I assess this as the complement of P. Thus, if I estimate P at a certain probability, not_P will be the remaining probability, which logically must sum to 1 with P.

The question para_P is similar to P, as it asks if it is possible for a Trump family member to secure the nomination. Given the same reasoning, I would assign a probability that reflects the likelihood of the scenario presented in P.

For Q, concerning the likelihood of at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, I would rely on scientific consensus and current climate models, which suggest a significant probability of this occurring if current trends continue. This question is independent of the Trump family nomination question, as it pertains to environmental science rather than political dynamics.

P_and_Q examines both conditions occurring simultaneously. The probability for this would be calculated based on the individual probabilities of P and Q, considering their independence or correlation. 

P_or_Q evaluates the likelihood that at least one of the two scenarios (Trump family nominee or significant global warming) will occur. This probability is typically higher than either individual probability, as it considers both events. 

Q_and_not_P evaluates if there will be significant warming while no Trump family member is nominated. This requires careful consideration of the probabilities of both events happening together. 

Finally, Q_given_P looks at the probability of global warming occurring, given that a Trump family member is the nominee. This is a conditional probability that may not be independent, as political decisions can influence environmental policies. 

In summary, my estimates will be based on the interplay between these events, their independence, and the current context surrounding them. I will ensure that the probabilities adhere to the consistency rules provided.

Q.title: Will we find life on Mars by 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No

All these probabilities must adhere to the consistency rules provided. P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) humanity discovers extraterrestrial life on Europa before 2045 and (b) unambiguous evidence of life on Mars is found before 2050?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

2. **not_P (No Trump Family Nominee)**: This is the complement of P. If P is estimated to be high, not_P must be low. Thus, I estimate not_P to be a lower probability.

6. **P_or_Q (Either Event Occurs)**: This is the probability that at least one of P or Q occurs. It will be higher than both P and Q since it includes scenarios where either event can occur.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Global Warming with No Trump Nominee)**: This question combines Q with the negation of P. The probability will depend on how likely global warming is versus the likelihood of a Trump family member being the nominee. If Q is high and P is low, this probability can be moderate.

8. **Q_given_P (Global Warming Given Trump Nominee)**: This conditional probability asks for the likelihood of Q occurring if P is true. If a Trump family member is the nominee, it might not significantly change the likelihood of global warming, so I will estimate this probability based on the assumption that the two events are somewhat independent.
